i mean, on at least one machine: what linux are you running now? if you can mount the CD, you can fairly easily check it

hmm. odd. anyway, put the install cd into this machine, and mount it (it should auto-mount)
ok, start a terminal, and type 'cd /media/cdrom'
then 'md5sum -c md5sum.txt|tee ~/md5results.txt' -- that will scroll info and write it to a file md5results.txt in your home dir
if there are any 'FAIL' entries, there's a problem; if not, the files should be OK
